tablemap.tablemap.get(tname, cols=None, df=False)¶

Get a list of rows (the whole table) ordered by cols.

Parameters

  • tname – table name

  • cols – comma separated string

Returns

a list of rows

tablemap.tablemap.register(**kwargs)¶

Register processes as keyword args.

import tablemap as tm 

tm.register(
    table_name = tm.load('sample.csv'),
    table_name1 = tm.apply(simple_process, 'table_name'),
)

tm.run()
tablemap.tablemap.run(**kwargs)¶

Run registered processes, only those that are not in the database and also that depend on those missing processes.

Parameters

  • ws (path as str) – working space, the default is where the script is.

  • locale – The default is en_US.UTF-8 (English_United States.1252 for Windows)

  • msg – You may not want visual noises in the terminal.

  • refresh (comma separated string of table names) –

    You may want to rerun the script over and over again, changing the code a bit. It could be tedious to delete the table everytime in those circumstances.

    Pass table names in string, for example ‘table1, table2’.

  • export (comma separated string of table names) – Export tables in csv. for example ‘table1, table2’ Those CSVs will be in the workspace as table1.csv, table2.csv.

Returns

Actually returns something for testing purposes, but not relavant.

tablemap.tablemap.select(cols, data=None, where=None, group_by=None, having=None, order_by=None)¶

tablemap.util module¶

tablemap.util.add(**kwargs)¶
tablemap.util.add_date(date, n)¶

n means days for “%Y-%m-%d”, months for “%Y-%m”. Supports only 2 fmt.

tablemap.util.allnum(rs, cols)¶

Returns a list of rows that all of columns are numeric.

Parameters

  • rs (list of rows) – [r1, r2, …]

  • cols (comma separated string) – ‘col1, col2’

Returns

list of rows

tablemap.util.avg(rs, col, wcol=None, ndigits=None)¶

Returns the average value of the given column.

Parameters

  • rs – a list of rows

  • col – str (column name)

  • wcol – str (column for weighted average)

  • ndigits – int (number of digits to the right of the decimal point)

Returns

a float

tablemap.util.chunk(rs, n, column=None)¶

Returns a list of rows in chunks

Parameters

  • rs – a list of rows

  • n –

    • int => returns 3 rows about the same size

    • list of ints, [0.3, 0.4, 0.3] => returns 3 rows of 30%, 40$, 30%

    • list of nums, [100, 500, 100] => returns 4 rows with break points 100, 500, 1000, but you must pass the column name for the break points like

    chunk(rs, [100, 500, 100], ‘col’)

  • column – column name for break points

Returns

a list of rows

tablemap.util.getX(rs, cols, constant=False)¶

Returns a list of lists (matrix X) for linear regression, if constant is True, X with a constant(1) column.

Parameters

  • rs – list of rows

  • cols – comma separated str for columns to be selected

  • constant – True or False

Returns

list of lists (matrix X)

tablemap.util.gety(rs, col)¶

Returns a list of numbers (matrix X) for linear regression

Parameters

rs – a list of

tablemap.util.step(grouped_seqs, stop_short=False)¶

Generates tuples of lists of rows for every matching keys

tablemap.util.where(pred, fn=None)¶

Filter with pred before you apply fn to a list of rows. if fn is not given, simply filter with pred
